12:32 <cjd> has quit  
12:34 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
12:34 <martinus\_\_> Hi all, I was wondering, where can I find all "text formatting" macros like {{info}} usage documentation ?  
12:35 <martinus\_\_> I mean, if this is built-in, why can't I find in syntax help  
12:35 <martinus\_\_> like error, warning, success macros  
12:36 <ClemensR> hm, the list of all wiki-level macros are in .../xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/WikiMacros , but some of the preconfigured macros are missing there  
12:37 <ClemensR> the syntax help itself is maintained manually, that is why it has no automatic list of macros ... but maybe it should ;)  
12:37 <visitor|57142> has joined #xwiki  
12:37 <tmortagne> most of the built in macros are documented on http://extensions.xwiki.org  
12:37 <ClemensR> after all the WYSIWYG-Editor can crate a list of them ... hmm  
12:37 <visitor|57142> has quit  
12:38 <tmortagne> but it's mixed with the other modules  
12:38 <tmortagne> ClemensR: yes it would be very easy to list all the macros  
12:38 <martinus\_\_> ClemensR, tmortagne intuitively, when I need to use such a macro, I'm going to XWikiSyntax  
12:39 <tmortagne> yea the XWikiSyntax is more about the syntax itself while macros are more extension of the syntax (even the embedded ones) but yes we need a clear list somewhere  
12:39 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, +1 I agree  
12:39 <martinus\_\_> a shortcut to a least  
12:39 <tmortagne> you have some on http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Macros  
12:40 <tmortagne> but it's not updated very often I think  
12:40 <tmortagne> but better than nothing  
12:40 <martinus\_\_> yes. I think at least builtin macro should have a corresponding help easy to access from a user perspective  
12:41 <ClemensR> maybe create this as an "Improvement"  issue on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI  ? as it seems it is really missing (and not that hard to implement, too)  
12:42 <martinus\_\_> ClemensR, I'm going to  
12:42 <ClemensR> thanks!  
12:42 <tmortagne> we could make .../xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/WikiMacros more generic and also add link to the actual documentation in it  
12:43 <tmortagne> (we can find the extension of a java class and get the extension.xwiki.org link from the extension id)  
12:47 <ClemensR> I thought as a first step one could show the information also shown in the WYSIWYG Editor (i.e what parameters), just for all macros at once, that is definitely doable  
12:53 <martinus\_\_> ClemensR, could you review http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12755 and update if needed (didn't know which components I should choose)  
12:53 <ClemensR> components is no problem, that will be set when the implementation happens :)  
12:56 <martinus\_\_> I have another question, about the markup used to call macros {{macro}} {{/macro}}. Was it totally mandatory to have distincts opening and closing tags instead of only one ?  
12:57 <martinus\_\_> like it's done in JIRA for ex.  
12:59 <martinus\_\_> I suppose it is for nesting needs or something  
12:59 <ClemensR> yes, for a) if you have no body you can just use {{macro /}}  
13:00 <ClemensR> and b) yes, it is to allow nesting (even though nesting the same macro does not happen very often ... but it is better for the parser anyway)  
13:01 <martinus\_\_> ClemensR, thanks  
13:21 <Denis> has quit  
13:21 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
13:21 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
13:41 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:08 <mflorea> guys, can you move the issues you don't plan to work on for 7.3RC1 so that we know what is left to do. The release was planned for today, but since the M2 release was delayed for a few days we can delay the RC1 too, but I'd like to know what is left to do. Thanks.  
14:09 <mflorea> http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=Project%20in%20%28%22XWiki%20Commons%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Rendering%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Platform%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Enterprise%22%29%20and%20fixVersion%20in%20%28%227.3-rc-1%22%29%20and%20resolution%20in%20%28%22Unresolved%22%29  
14:15 <vmassol> has quit  
14:23 <mflorea> Denis: do you plan to work/finish XWIKI-12570 or XWIKI-12165 by tomorrow or Wednesday?  
14:44 <Denis> mflorea: no  
14:44 <mflorea> Denis, ok, thanks, I'll move them, 7.4M1 is ok?  
14:45 <Denis> we have no better choice, I think  
14:45 <mflorea> ok

16:40 <visitor|97760> has quit  
17:06 <mflorea> tmortagne: enterprise build fails because there are some duplicated classes found (javax.xml.stream.\* and org.parboiled.\*) . Are they related to the recent dependency upgrades you did?  
17:07 <tmortagne> mflorea: probably, I tough I had fixed all the remaining duplicates  
17:07 <tmortagne> checking  
17:07 <tmortagne> hmm that's weird, the parboiled one is supposed to be fixed plus I changed the dependency version to 1.1.  
17:08 <tmortagne>  1.1.7  
17:08 <tmortagne> (which is what fix the conflict)  
17:09 <tmortagne> same for the stax-api, lets analyze it from XE war project point of view  
17:13 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
17:14 <tmortagne> hmm looks like a Maven bug  
17:14 <tmortagne> stax-api is excluded in the dependencyManagement but still ends up in the WAR  
17:23 <tmortagne> actually it was the opposite, a bug on M2E  
17:28 <tmortagne> hmm for parboiled it's definitely a Maven bug not properly handling dependencyManagement, I will have to move it to commons I guess  
17:29 <tmortagne> (I get the right one when looking from markdown module but the wrong one when looking from XE)  
17:30 <tmortagne> we should maybe start to upgrade the reference Maven version we use I guess  
17:31 <tmortagne> actually it's not better with 3.3.1
